intro: Hieracium praecox subsp. ovalifolium, commonly known as the early hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Native to Europe, it thrives in grassy areas and disturbed soils. The plant has a creeping growth habit and produces achenes as its fruit. It is often found in open habitats such as meadows and roadsides.
